duties_responsibilities.duty: Act as a representative and advocate of the company's culture and guiding principles.
Responsible for quality, schedule, and performance for assigned trades/section of the project.
Perform Material Manager duties, including conducting inspections and preparing punch lists.
Coordinate deliveries of direct purchased materials and inventory management.
Schedule and inventory deliveries of direct purchased materials such as lumber, trusses, rough hardware, windows, etc.
Assess the status of construction to determine the order in which to complete the project.
Prepare agenda and minutes of safety/production meetings as assigned by supervisor.
Inspect subcontractors’ work for compliance with Quality Control and ADA/FHA checklists.
Coordinate temporary laborers and dumpster hauling.
Review approved submittals and schedule pre-con meetings with subcontractors.
Conduct rough frame walks and coordinate readiness for an inspection.
Coordinate the mock-ups and schedule and coordinate the elevator construction.
Work with the punch carpenter for accuracy and completeness and maintain storage/laydown areas, temporary toilets, handwash stations, parking, and clean-up labor.
Lock up and close down the job site and assist in the resolution of on-site subcontractor issues.
Compile information on subcontractor employee head counts for the Daily Report.
Conduct COVID temperature checks and other safety walks with the safety inspector.

education_certification.credential: Minimum of five years of construction experience with at least three years multi-family construction experience required.
Must be familiar with multifamily construction procedures.
Must have good working knowledge of construction scheduling practices.
